headline.main: MANY NAZIS KILLED; Foes' Total Casualties on 2 Soviet Fronts Put at 155,700 GERMANS' LINES FIRMER But Moscow Reports Gains West of Moscow and In and About Stalingrad MANY NAZIS KILLED ON 2 SOVIET FRONTS THE RUSSIANS ADVANCE THROUGH THE RUINS OF STALINGRAD

lead_paragraph: MOSCOW, Tuesday, Dec. 1 -- The Red Army killed 7,500 more Germans and knocked out seventy-five tanks on the blizzard-swept central front west of Moscow and gained six miles near Stalingrad yesterday in twin offensives that still were rolling onward despite desperate Nazi counter-attacks, the Russians announced early today.
abstract: USSR repts on Ger losses; Stalingrad, Nov 26-30
